definition: vivid/lively/(of food ingredients) live or fresh

sentences.english: The reward for facing fear is that you get to be fully alive.
sentences.chinese: 面对恐惧的奖励就是你变得完全的鲜活了。
蛏子》这个好像叫“蛏子”，看来很鲜活。

sentences.english: The refrigerated vehicles are suitaBle for long-distance transport of live aquatic products for sale.
sentences.chinese: 水产保鲜车，适宜长途贩运鲜活水产品。

sentences.english: Youth is the freshness of the deep spring of life!
sentences.chinese: 青春是生命春意正浓的鲜活记忆。

sentences.english: Every moment of life is living.
sentences.chinese: 生活中的每刻都是鲜活的。

sentences.english: These houses has its own unique living life.
sentences.chinese: 这些宅院都有自己独特鲜活的生命。

sentences.english: They do not simply bring history to life.
sentences.chinese: 这不仅仅是为了让历史更鲜活。

sentences.english: Holiness, that which is holy, is often associated with life.
sentences.chinese: 而神圣总是和鲜活的生命联系在一起。

sentences.english: It's a tight little character arc that fleshes out a bit player.
sentences.chinese: 总而言之，这个小人物的紧凑剧情让它变得无比鲜活。

sentences.english: it is the freshness of the deep spring of life.
sentences.chinese: 青春是指生命深泉的清新鲜活。

sentences.english: The nonthermal sterilization is essential for fresh-cutting vegetables as a method for fresh-cutting vegetables preservation.
sentences.chinese: 鲜切菜属于鲜活商品，因此采用冷杀菌工艺十分重要。

sentences.english: These social encounters are experiences that allow us to feel most alive.
sentences.chinese: 社会的邂逅让我们更加鲜活地体会到这种经历。

sentences.english: You prefer your shrimp with the heads and legs still attached-it means they're fresh.
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢连头带尾的虾，这样你知道虾是鲜活的。

definition: life (as the characteristic of living beings)/living being/creature/CL:個|个[ge4],條|条[tiao2]
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
opportunity to live/to reprieve from death/life force/vitality
